intro: Oncostylis vestita, commonly known as the slender oncostylis, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and are clustered in inflorescences. Oncostylis vestita is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
